Container.Name: NeverwinterNights-EE
Container.Overview:
This Docker will download and install Neverwinter Nights: Enhanced Edition and run it (by default this container has a MariaDB and Redis Server integrated).
First Start: Enter the Module name to load in the variable down below (without the .mod extension) start the container and wait for it until the log displays the message that the modules folder is empty, stop the container and place your mod file in the folder (.../Neverwinter Nights/modules) and restart the container (You can also place a mod file from your local installed game into the server eg.: .../Neverwinter Nights/data/mod/Contest of Champions 0492).
ATTENTION: First Startup can take very long since it downloads the gameserver files!
Update Notice: Simply restart the container if a newer version of the game is available.

Config.Name: ServerFiles
Config.Description: Container Path: /nwnee

Config.Name: Log Level
Config.Description: Set the log level (from 2=only fatal errors to 7=very verbose)

Config.Name: UDP - Game Port
Config.Description: UDP Game Port

Config.Name: Module Name
Config.Description: Enter the module name to load here (located in your serverdirectory 'Neverwinter Nights/modules' without the .mod extension)

Config.Name: Game Version
Config.Description: Enter your preferred game version or set to 'latest' (without quotes) to check for the latest version on every restart.

Config.Name: Maximum Clients
Config.Description: Set the maximum number of connections to the game server.

Config.Name: Minimum Character Level
Config.Description: Set the minimum character level required by the server.

Config.Name: Maximum Character Level
Config.Description: Set the maximum character level allowed by the server.

Config.Name: Player Pause
Config.Description: Set if a player or DM can pause the game (0 = game can only be paused by DM, 1 = game can by paused by players)

Config.Name: PVP Mode
Config.Description: Set wich PVP mode do you want (0 = none, 1 = party, 2 = full)

Config.Name: Servercharacters Only
Config.Description: Set if local or server characters (0 = local characters only. 1 = server characters only)

Config.Name: Enforce Legal Characters
Config.Description: Set enforcing legal characters (0 = don't enforce legal characters, 1 = do enforce legal characters)

Config.Name: Enforce Item Level Restriction
Config.Description: Set enforcing item level restriction (0 = don't enforce item level restrictions, 1 = do enforce item level restrictions)

Config.Name: Multiple Parties Allowed
Config.Description: Set if one or more parties are allowed (0 = allow only one party, 1 = allow multiple parties)

Config.Name: Difficulty
Config.Description: Set difficutly (1 = easy, 2 = normal, 3 = D&D hardcore, 4 = very difficult)

Config.Name: Autosave Intervall
Config.Description: Set how frequently (in minutes) to autosave. 0 disables autosave.

Config.Name: Server Name
Config.Description: Set the name this server appears as in the mulitplayer game listing.

Config.Name: Connection Password
Config.Description: Set the password required by players to join the game.

Config.Name: Admin Password
Config.Description: Set the password required to remotely administer the game. Currently unused.

Config.Name: Public Server
Config.Description: Set if you want to list the game publicly (0 = do not list server with the matching service. 1 = list server with the matching service).

Config.Name: Restart Module If Server Becomes Empty
Config.Description: Restart module if server becomes empty (0 = module state is persistant as long as server is running, 1 = module state is reset when the server becomes empty).

Config.Name: Extra Startup Parameters
Config.Description: Enter your extra game startup parameters if needed here (eg: '-dmpassword supersecretpassword -quiet' without quotes).
